intro: Marumia rufolanata, commonly known as the red-stemmed marumia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with a fine layer of hair. Marumia rufolanata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
